reviewText: Have been a fan of Eddies a long time, he is just so funny without even trying...he gives us even a history lesson from time to time that might leave us Americans a bit embarrased! This was so good and look forward to more, wish he was coming to the area so I could see him live, want a good laugh check it out, also he seldom used bad language which is really great.

reviewText: This is a great show and if you are a fan of Eddie Izzard, you will be happy you bought this and added it to your collection.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I came here to buy the DVD but the description of the product does not say if there is captioning, or subtitles. How nice. Two stars for leaving out this vital info . . . shafting the hearing impaired once again Eddie. What's up with that? You used to be kind and captioned everything. So, shall I buy knowing there may not be captioning? Hmm? Decisions, decisions . . .
summary: The description of the product does not say if there is captioning
Title: N/A

reviewText: A fabulous combination of Robin Williams' manic improv, the Monty Python crew's oblique and unexpected juxtapositions and the speed of a bullet train -- put these into a gorgeous package with mesh stockings, nail polish and lots of mascara and you have the fastest, funniest monologuist/humorist in the world.  Who is he second to?  When he is Mel Brooks' age, ask us again.  If Izzard can keep this up until then, he will have the title.Izzard compliments us by assuming we can keep up with him.  Perhaps that's why his DVDs are so useful -- eventually, we get it all. Keep patience with us, Eddie.  And keep performing.  We'll love you anywhere.
summary: The Second Funniest Man in the World
Title: N/A

reviewText: You have to pay attention, there are no quick cheap one-liners here, Mr. Izzard works for the laughs.  I love this guy and this is a solid performance.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Let me be clear about this, Eddie Izzard and his Madison Square Garden Performance is fantastic. He is on and in classic form.Although the opening sequence with Secret Agent Eddie exploring New York is lame and goes on too long.The problem with this release is the quality of the DVD. The production quality is terrible. It is spliced together from 3 different sources. I suspect it was cobbled together by the director's son as part of his 11th Grade AV Class Final. One moment it is broadcast quality with good sound then it cuts (often times, mid sentence) to a crap video feed with terrible audio then it cuts to a horrible grainy feed from the balcony with barely audible sound and stays there for 2-3 minutes then the cycle starts over. Best way to sum it up = it feels like there was a professionally recorded version used for broadcast spliced together with someone's Sony Handycam footage taken from the balcony and then inter-cut with steady cam footage from stage left. The quality is bad, but the comedy is top shelf.
summary: Eddie Izzard is Fantastico, but the DVD isn't
Title: N/A

reviewText: Eddie Izzard is amazing.  Very intelligent material without being pedantic; more of a monologist (is that even a word?) than a comedian.  It seems hard for stand-up comedians to become actors and then to successfully go back to stand-up.  He seems to do both very very well.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Love Eddie, but he often gets so wrapped up in his own cleverness that he runs a particular riff way past the point where it's funny or even entertaining.
summary: Love Eddie, but he often gets so wrapped up ...
Title: N/A

reviewText: Giving his love of infusing history into his comedy (note to previous reviewer, not a "gimmick", he jokes about the history we are taught, and he gives us food for thought, correcting the -oh-so-erroneous) I found the DVD funny, but not the constant hilarity of past stand up shows.Loved the minor mention of Mrs. Badcrumble, and the i-am-laughing-inside-as-well look.As to the debunking of silly christian (and other religions, he is not prejudiced) ancedotes - Noah's Ark in particular - he hit it out of the ballpark.  NOT OFFENSIVE at all.  I am somewhat surprised that any opinion would be Eddie Izzard is offensive.  I have found him to be the least offensive comedian.  And I watch a LOT of comedians.Good, but not great.  Worth buying and keeping in the DVD collection.
Title: N/A
